question.title: What is the purpose of the 14-day examination (2nd week) in the compulsory medical examinations for infants and children?
question.description: The 14-day examination is a routine check-up to monitor the child's growth and development.

option_a.title: To detect any signs of illness or disease
option_a.description: The 14-day examination is primarily focused on detecting any signs of illness or disease in the child.

option_b.title: To assess the child's cognitive development
option_b.description: The 14-day examination is also used to assess the child's cognitive development and identify any potential delays.

option_c.title: To evaluate the child's motor skills and coordination
option_c.description: The 14-day examination is used to evaluate the child's motor skills and coordination, including their ability to walk and run.

option_d.title: To screen for orthopaedic abnormalities
option_d.description: The 14-day examination is also used to screen for orthopaedic abnormalities, such as scoliosis or other musculoskeletal issues.
